# Working with attribute table {#attr}

To be proficient at working with attribute data in **sf** means being proficient with handling data frames in R. This is a broad topic beyond the scope of this tutorial.
The subsequent examples demonstrate how attribute data in `sf` classes can be manipulated as data frames, and how to add/remove geometry data.

```{r, eval=FALSE}
# subsetting simple feature rows
w[1:3,]
```

```{r}
# subsetting simple feature columns
selc = 1:3
w_few_cols = w[selc]
head(w_few_cols)
```
